Package com.sicomsa.dmt.svc

Class LocalRepository

java.lang.Object
com.sicomsa.dmt.svc.LocalRepository
All Implemented Interfaces:
DownloadRepository
public class LocalRepository extends Object implements DownloadRepository
Download repository implementation that saves downloads in a specified directory.

The directory can be defined when instantiating this class or it can be set afterwards. Order in which the class defines the directory:

  1. The downloadDir property set either by the constructor or by the setDownloadDirectory(java.io.File) method.
  2. A non empty path provided by the method System.getProperty(java.lang.String) using the property name DOWNLOAD_PATH_PROPERTY.
  3. A download directory found under the user home directory provided by the JVM

Note: download directory must exist

You can know what directory this repository will use with the method: getDownloadDirectory()

It is suggested that you test the download directory before making actual downloads. With something like this:

 LocalRepository repository = new LocalRepository();
 System.out.println("downloadDirectory="+repository.getDownloadDirectory());
 File file = new File(repository.getDownloadDirectory(), "test.txt");
 byte[] data = new byte[10];
 try (FileOutputStream out = new FileOutputStream(file)) {
      out.write(data);
        out.flush();
   }
Since:
1.0

    • save

      public void save(String rfc, String packageId, String encodedPackage, Object params) throws RepositoryException
      Saves the specified encodedPackage in the defined directory of this repository.
      Specified by:
      save in interface DownloadRepository
      Parameters:
      rfc - RFC of download requestor
      packageId - package identifier of this downloaded package
      encodedPackage - the downloaded package
      params - alternative parameter
      Throws:
      RepositoryException - if unable to save package in repository
      IllegalArgumentException - if rfc or packageId are null or blank
      IllegalArgumentException - - if encodedPackage is not in valid Base64 scheme
      NullPointerException - - if encodedPackage is null
      See Also:
      • DescargaResponse.getEncodedPackage()

    • defineDirectory

      protected File defineDirectory()
      Returns the File directory where the downloads will be saved.

      If the method System.getProperty(DOWNLOAD_PATH_PROPERTY) returns a non blank path, this path will be used. If it is not set then a download directory will be searched under the user home directory provided by the JVM.

      Returns:
      the File directory where the downloads will be saved

    • downloadsDirNames

      protected String[] downloadsDirNames()
      Returns a string array of posible download directory file names.
      Returns:
      a string array of posible download directory file names

    • findDownloadsDirectory

      protected File findDownloadsDirectory(String userHome)

      Parameters:
      userHome - the path to find a directory from
      Returns:
      a File from the ones specified in the method downloadDirNames(), below the path defined by userHome or null if no existing directory was found
